modules.description: Provides functions to construct and execute sandboxed command invocations using bwrap, including setting up environment variables, mounting directories, and defining capabilities. Operates with types representing command arguments, environment maps, and mount configurations. Used to isolate processes for secure execution of untrusted code or to enforce resource constraints during builds.

This module provides functions for configuring and managing sandboxed environments, enabling process isolation through controlled filesystem mounts, user/group ID settings, and namespace restrictions like network and PID isolation. It operates on a `conf` type to define sandbox parameters and supports operations such as symlink creation, directory changes, and process execution with explicit I/O handling. Use cases include securely running untrusted code, restricting resource access, and ensuring process containment in restricted execution scenarios.
